availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Logan Williams (Lincoln County, KY, minister, educator, univ curator)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, Christian minister. Son of Samuel Williams.Married to Amanda F. White Williams in 1848. Father of Samuel S. Williams. Married to Catherine “Kate” Logan Williams in Garrard County on September 27, 1855. Married to Amanda C. Bailey Williams in Lincoln County on September 29, 1857. Father of Catharine “Kate” Bailey Williams. Married to Pamelia Peyton Williams in 1861. Graduated from Centre College in 1846. Graduated from the Theological Seminary and licensed to preach. Worked for the Kentucky State Board of Missions. Teacher in Lincoln County in 1850. Raised money to build Church of Christ in Hustonville and preached there. Minister in Lincoln County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Lincoln County in 1860. Household owned twelve additional enslaved persons in Lincoln County in 1860. Founded Christian College in Hustonville, Kentucky. Member of the board of curators of Kentucky University in 1865.
